com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.data

Interface SettableByIndex<SelfT extends SettableByIndex<SelfT>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AccessibleByIndex, Data
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Bindable<SelfT>, BoundStatement, SettableById<SelfT>, SettableByName<SelfT>, TupleValue, UdtValue
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoundStatementBuilder

    public interface SettableByIndex<SelfT extends SettableByIndex<SelfT>>
extends AccessibleByIndex
    A data structure that provides methods to set its values via an integer index.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setBytesUnsafe

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
SelfT setBytesUnsafe(int i,
                                                 @Nullable
                                                 ByteBuffer v)
        Sets the raw binary representation of the ith value.

        This is primarily for internal use; you'll likely want to use one of the typed setters instead, to pass a higher-level Java representation.

        Parameters:
        v - the raw value, or null to set the CQL value NULL. For performance reasons, this is the actual instance used internally. If pass in a buffer that you're going to modify elsewhere in your application, make sure to duplicate it beforehand. If you change the buffer's index or its contents in any way, further usage of this data will have unpredictable results.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.

      • setToNull

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default SelfT setToNull(int i)
        Sets the ith value to CQL NULL.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.

      • set

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default <ValueT> SelfT set(int i,
                                                       @Nullable
                                                       ValueT v,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       TypeCodec<ValueT> codec)
        Sets the ith value, using the given codec for the conversion.

        This method completely bypasses the Data.codecRegistry(), and forces the driver to use the given codec instead. This can be useful if the codec would collide with a previously registered one, or if you want to use the codec just once without registering it.

        It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the given codec is appropriate for the conversion. Failing to do so will result in errors at runtime.

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.

      • set

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default <ValueT> SelfT set(int i,
                                                       @Nullable
                                                       ValueT v,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       GenericType<ValueT> targetType)
        Sets the ith value, converting it to the given Java type.

        The Data.codecRegistry() will be used to look up a codec to handle the conversion.

        This variant is for generic Java types. If the target type is not generic, use set(int, Object, Class) instead, which may perform slightly better.

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.
        CodecNotFoundException - if no codec can perform the conversion.

      • set

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default <ValueT> SelfT set(int i,
                                                       @Nullable
                                                       ValueT v,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       Class<ValueT> targetClass)
        Returns the ith value, converting it to the given Java type.

        The Data.codecRegistry() will be used to look up a codec to handle the conversion.

        If the target type is generic, use set(int, Object, GenericType) instead.

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.
        CodecNotFoundException - if no codec can perform the conversion.

      • setBoolean

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default SelfT setBoolean(int i,
                                                     boolean v)
        Sets the ith value to the provided Java primitive boolean.

        By default, this works with CQL type boolean.

        To set the value to CQL NULL, use setToNull(int), or set(i, v, Boolean.class).

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.

      • setToken

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default SelfT setToken(int i,
                                                   @NonNull
                                                   Token v)
        Sets the ith value to the provided token.

        This works with the CQL type matching the partitioner in use for this cluster: bigint for Murmur3Partitioner, blob for ByteOrderedPartitioner, and varint for RandomPartitioner.

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.

      • setList

        @NonNull
 @CheckReturnValue
default <ElementT> SelfT setList(int i,
                                                             @Nullable
                                                             List<ElementT> v,
                                                             @NonNull
                                                             Class<ElementT> elementsClass)
        Sets the ith value to the provided Java list.

        By default, this works with CQL type list.

        This method is provided for convenience when the element type is a non-generic type. For more complex list types, use set(int, Object, GenericType).

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.
